channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Angst pervades a pair of Republican town halls — one in Trump country, the other in a swing state
A law in New York pushes doctors to be upfront about patients' costs
item.description: The law originally banned health care providers from forcing patients to agree to pay medical bills, no matter the cost. Consumer groups say an amende...

item.title: Cousins fill in at dance, cancer survivor breaks record, beaver saves sanctuary
item.description: CBS News contributor David Begnaud shares heartfelt stories from viewers in the latest installment of "Dear David."

item.title: Heat can age you as much as smoking, a new study finds
item.description: Exposure to heat can alter the way your DNA works, according to a new study. The effects could lead to long-term health outcomes.

item.title: Carney meets Macron on first foreign visit as PM
item.description: Carney described Canada as the "most European of non-European countries".

item.title: Mar 17: CBS News 24/7, 10am ET
item.description: Trump administration deports hundreds of immigrants under Alien Enemies Act; NIH cuts raise concerns over impact on vaccine research.

item.title: Her cancer diagnosis made motherhood both harder and more sweet
item.description: As cancer rates rise among people under 50, more and more parents are facing the heightened emotions and challenging logistics of raising kids while g...

item.title: Rwanda severs ties with Belgium over 'neo-colonial delusions'
item.description: In a strongly worded statement, Rwanda accuses Belgium of "lies and manipulation".

item.title: Lithuania accuses Russia over Ikea store fire in Vilnius
item.description: Nato allies believe Russia is running sabotage operations to undermine European support for Ukraine.

item.title: PepsiCo to buy prebiotic brand Poppi for nearly $2 billion
item.description: PepsiCo will acquire healthier soda brand Poppi as it strives to diversify into soda and snack offerings.

item.title: Schumer postpones book tour, citing "security concerns" after funding vote
item.description: The postponements come amid expected protests in response to his vote to advance a Republican measure to avert a shutdown.

item.title: Severe weather moves east after tornadoes, winds and wildfires killed at least 39 people
item.description: Foreboding predictions of dangerous weekend weather came true as a dynamic storm spawned tornadoes, dust storms and wildfires that killed more than th...

item.title: How a firefighter's quick action saved his friend's life
item.description: Ronald Osborne was a firefighter for many years. Early in his career, while battling a house fire, his life was in danger. It was another firefighter'...

item.title: Oklahomans survey devastation after hundreds of homes are destroyed and damaged by wildfires
'Red Scare' revisits the fear of Communism that gripped post-WWII America
item.description: Writer Clay Risen describes the anti-Communist frenzy that destroyed the careers of thousands of teachers, union activists and civil servants — and co...

item.title: Why are HELOC rates so much lower than home equity loans now? Experts weigh in
item.description: HELOC interest rates are near two-year lows, making them significantly cheaper than home equity loans. Here's why.

item.title: Trade turmoil forecast to slash growth in Canada and Mexico
item.description: Trump's tariffs will hit its biggest steel trading partners' economies the most, the OECD predicts.

item.title: White House denies defying judge's order over deportations to El Salvador
item.description: An order to halt the removal of 261 people came too late and had "no legal basis" anyway, the White House says.
